citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
** A six year old, date of birth 01-04-17, male, black and tan Yorkie, micro-chip 7E10211041. Had a buildup of dark matter
on the teeth and red gums.
** A six year old date of birth 12-21-17, female black and silver Poodle, micro-chip 2194966. Had a buildup of dark matter
on the teeth and red gums.
** A five year old, date of birth 12-02-18, male, black and Tan Yorkie, micro-chip 2874016. Had a buildup of dark matter
on the teeth and red gums.
A buildup of dark matter and red gums can lead to dental disease, cause pain and tooth loss. The dogs listed must be
seen by a veterinarian to determine if treatment is necessary. The licensee must follow the dental plan to provide for the
health and well-being of the animals. All license's must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose and treat
diseases.
To be corrected by: 07-25-23.

** The licensee did not have medical records for the dogs. All licensee's must have medical records for the dogs. To
include identity of the animal, breed, sex and age. Routine husbandry, vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, or
treatments. All licensees must keep and maintain medical records for dogs to ensure proper veterinary care and provide
for the well-being of the animals.
To be corrected by: 08-11-23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
DAVID SABALA, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
** A six year old, date of birth 01-04-17, male, black and tan Yorkie, micro-chip 7E10211041. Had a buildup of dark matter 
on the teeth and red gums. 
 
** A six year old date of birth 12-21-17, female black and silver Poodle, micro-chip 2194966. Had a buildup of dark matter 
on the teeth and red gums. 
 
** A five year old, date of birth 12-02-18, male, black and Tan Yorkie, micro-chip 2874016. Had a buildup of dark matter 
on the teeth and red gums. 
 
A buildup of dark matter and red gums can lead to dental disease, cause pain and tooth loss. The dogs listed must be 
seen by a veterinarian to determine if treatment is necessary. The licensee must follow the dental plan to provide for the 
health and well-being of the animals. All license's must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose and treat 
diseases. 
 
To be corrected by: 07-25-23. 
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
** The licensee did not have medical records for the dogs. All licensee's must have medical records for the dogs. To 
include identity of the animal, breed, sex and age. Routine husbandry, vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, or 
treatments. All licensees must keep and maintain medical records for dogs to ensure proper veterinary care and provide 
for the well-being of the animals. 
To be corrected by: 08-11-23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.

Additional Inspectors: 
DAVID SABALA, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
